page.title: 05INDUSTRY IN LEADENHAM
page.content: Apart from farming,which is dealt with separately,local industries are small and light.One of these is Peck Vehicle Heating.This is a small family run engineering company engaged in design and manufacture of heaters for commercial vehicles.The factory is on a former railway siding where Queen Victoria's royal train would night stop to Scotland.COSIRA were involved in setting up a factory which employs 17 people but generates work in three other towns.Gordon Marshall runs his business at the Mill on the A17 leading from the village towards Newark.Until recently,reclaimed timber was sold here,which was a great asset to people carrying out repairs to old buildings. Now the business is devoted to the manufacture of pine furniture. Eighteen people are employed by the firm.
